title: Mount Taranaki
summary: Mount Taranaki or Taranaki Maunga, also known by its former name, Mount Egmont, is a dormant stratovolcano in the Taranaki region on the west coast of New Zealand's North Island.[4][5] It is the second highest point in the North Island, after Mount Ruapehu. The 2,518-metre (8,261 ft) mountain has a secondary cone, Fanthams Peak (Māori: Panitahi), 1,966 metres (6,450 ft), on its south side.[6]
